i noticed that this torrent's files are windows media files and was wondering if they could be written to DVD-Rs and be viewed with DVD players and the like. This is the first torrent like this that I have downloaded and I am not sure how they work. Any help would be much appreciated.

Burning windows media files to DVD-R's will probably only work if you're using a burning program like Toast or Nero. Just burning the files themselves onto a DVD-R will just make a data DVD so you'll only be able to read the files on your computer. If you have a burning program, look in the documentation to see if it will accept windows media files, because I'm not sure all of them do.

"Burning windows media files to DVD-R's will probably only work if you're using a burning program like Toast or Nero. Just burning the files themselves onto a DVD-R will just make a data DVD so you'll only be able to read the files on your computer. If you have a burning program, look in the documentation to see if it will accept windows media files, because I'm not sure all of them do."
Not if you have one of those fancy DVD players that can play MPEG, DiVx, and other video codecs!  Then you can just put your Data DVD in the drive and FULL SCREEN BABY!!  ;)

My dvd player plays most codecs and formats (oog is a bit glitchy at times). I got it for 200 USD at sams club w/a pretty good surround included in that 200 bucks. Schweet!!! Back on track, I dont have enough room on my hard drive, so I hope this is still here when I get me another.
I forgot to add, just download "ConvertXtoDvD", its very easy and fast (~2x convert times) it also adds a root menu, very handy.
